H0.text: Shining a light on the mineral is the best way for the student to find out the sample’s cleavage pattern, which for mica is a smooth, flat sheet.

H1.text: Soaking the mineral in water is the best way for the student to determine the sample’s cleavage pattern, revealing whether it matches mica’s smooth, flat sheet.

H2.text: Rubbing a penny against the mineral is how the student can best determine whether the sample exhibits mica’s characteristic smooth, flat sheet cleavage.

H3.text: Breaking off a piece of the mineral is the best way for a student to observe the sample’s cleavage pattern and determine whether it is mica, since mica’s cleavage is a smooth, flat sheet.
